result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rashad N Shabazz

Defendant Rashad N Shabazz appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Hauser appeared by video for Rashad N Shabazz.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Rashad N Shabazz not in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Hauser in court for Rashad N Shabazz.  Attorney John Theodore Chisholm in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defense received discovery.  State is awaiting blood test results.Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Rashad N Shabazz in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Rashad N Shabazz in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rashad N Shabazz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
